name: Survivor Squad
description: Survivor Squad is a Strategy Action game where you control a Squad of up to four survivors and guide them through a highly randomized world looking for supplies to aid you on your journey.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1.7Ghz Code 2 Duo Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: Radeon 3850 or equivalent Storage: 900 MB available space

reviews.review_text: This is a fun game, but good luck finding anyone to play multiplayer. You can technically spend as long as you like with single player, building up safehouses, resources, and survivors to fight the infected onslaught. Otherwise, you can just burn through this game in a few hours -- you only need to kill the 'brain bug' type of monster to win, so you can leave plenty of areas uncleared before completing the game.  If you want a moderately challenging single-player campaign, pick this up when it is on sale. $5 or less is my recommendation.

20141106 - 8-10 hours playtime...  The playtime isn't bad for such a low budget game, However, I just ran into a bug that completely blocked game progression - due to a 'defend' mission not ending - nor allowing me to withdraw.  Elevator pitch: Top down scavage & survive in a Left 4 Dead style zombie world...  Review: This game could have been epic, but the bugs, near programmer level art, flat and unexiting skillsystem make for a very flat and unengaging experience in the end... It is a shame, because a few bits taken care of - this could easily have been worth €20+. Such as: - A massive bug-hunt... - An art overhaul... - More skills both in number and variation... - Some added gameplay features like sneak, move&fire, etc.  ...as it stands - I guess I'm ok with donating €6 to the dev for a good try. Perhaps if he gets enough such donations he will wrap this up into the game it deserves to be.   Recommend? This is a hard call... really hard. While I really DO want to recommend this rough diamond - the developer has all but carried himself to the finishing-line and needs but fall over to complete the product - unfortunately I can not recommend a game which has a progression blocks.  If I see regular updates - I will reconsider this assessment.
Nice game to relax :D

Survivor Squad is a top-down strategic survivor management game. The review will be represented with a simplistic 'Pros/Cons/Neutral' format. Pros: * Can be run with even a potato * Been in multiple bundles, so value is cheap * Good concept * Scavenging * Mechanics like the horde, which make you hide indoors * Still manages to create a believeable atmosphere * A lot of gameplay hidden here  Neutral: * Stealth, but extremely whimsily made * Graphics look like they were made with paint sometimes * Randomized world, but no personality to it  Cons: * Survivors have no personality with no real reason to care about their survivor, except for their experience points and levels * Repetitive * Bad controls * Unclear campaign objectives other than 'There is scientist, he know cure, we go get!' * The enemy types are indestinguishable sometimes  Overall:  6/10 Buy it only during a sale, from a bundle or trade for it.
An RTS version of Zafehouse Diaries. Not particularly deep but well designed and executed.

Fun, challenging and frustrating all at the same time. The gameplay is easy to grasp but the smallest mistakes can result in a massacre. As others have mentioned it has annoyances here and there, but overall it works.

Nice little Zombie game with a tactical approach. It also seems to be randomized each time you play so it is somehow rogue like. It is very important to place your soldiers tactically. Rushing in a building with all 4 soldiers might get you swamped with Zombies. So scout the place first, stealth kill stray Zeds, thin the Zeds by shooting through windows and so on. But always have someone cover the back as Zombies can sneak up from behind. Use your gadgets wisely! There are some elements that force you making quick decisions like bombs, alarm traps and Zombie spawning room size hearts :D

Fun game, however my main issue is that the game will toss you into a brick wall. What I mean by that is you go to your first level 3 area and get destroyed because tons of specials attack at once and all of your survivors die because they cannot fight the horde. I really do like this game but some changes need to be made so I can stop save scuming to get passed a single node, which is my only way to progress.

the game developers thinks its done NO way it is a zombie killed my through a wall 10/10 -.- the controlls are useless also you have to place a marker For the charachters to get to it some of the controlls dont even work i tried to hit a zombie by pressing e and it did nothing so i died overall its an ok game but its no where near done yet i wouldent really recommend
Its easy to play fun all around, if your into a team based zombie survival game so i recommend its worth it.

Fantastic game! Its a combination of RTS, Survival, RPG, and Zombie game play that forms into a truley in depth game. The game gets intense when you have to press forward through a horde of zombies while covering your flank creating a cycle of death and you move forward inch by inch.
Great game. Just wish you could control your character with WASD

Great concept, game has a lot of promise but it's unfinished. Gameplay becomes tedious, storyline isn't engaging and there are a few annoying bugs that make it hard to progress at times.  Also apparently only men survive the zombie apocalypse, and they all have the same voice... :P

For all ye souls who purchased this game at its normal price, 8.99, I feel sorry for you. I too, looking at the videos and pics of gameplay thought this game looked pretty good. Of course, any product may look good in theory and before the initial tryout, but this game is seriously not worth the biggest sale price they could give you. Maybe free, it would be relevent, but this game is incomplete, and seriously a dissappointment. Its kinda like when 2K announced they were remaking the famous XCOM game, but then they also announced that they were making it a shooter. Although they did make the new XCOM and did a really good job. Sadly, this product isnt even halfway close to the aforementioned situation. The devs sold this game for 8.99, which is not that bad of a price for a good game, but this game is just bad. Its incomplete, buggy, and if youve been listening to what the devs say, they think that the game being incomplete actually makes it complete. Thats sad. So please, STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME. EVEN IF ITS ON SALE, DO NOT GIVE THESE DEVS A SINGLE PENNY.
Great Game!!!!!
AWESOME GAME FOR 23P!

To be reductive: It is Left 4 Dead the (budget) pausable strategy game.  You start a mission, kill all the zombies, search all the searchables, collect all the 'loot', end the mission, go back to base, level up, craft, and equip for the next mission. Repeat until bored.  It is a lot of fun. Worth a buy at $5 not $9. Wait for a sale.`
not only is there an ad for the devs other game , you are also forced to see another ad for the game when you try to quit the game , thats just stupid

Top-down squad-based zombie shooter RPG.  The campaign feels very free and open. Watching your men shoot zombies is very visceral and exciting.  You advance through checkpoints on a map, capturing and securing resource nodes in an attempt to exterminate zombies from the face of the earth. You can scavenge new materials, weapons and blueprints from buildings.  Many of the buildings repeat very often. A greater variety of layouts would have been really nice, I have only seen four or five constructs so far.  Special zombies are extremely dangerous, and can temporarily disable one of your squad, making it necessary to travel in groups of two or more.  Weapons and armors seem a little expensive, but it doesn't kill the sense of advancement.  Overall, I definitely reccommend this game. A good buy for tactical gameplay fanatics.
Not bad, but not great either. There are much better options for comparable, or better price points, NEO scavenger, State of Decay, Project Zomboid, Don't Starve... the list goes on...
Really nice atmosphere game with a prety cute graphic.A lot of defferent levels and crafts. Also have a lot of icons and achievements.  9/10 for the Steam sale price  7/10 for the ordinary price
A pretty meh game i picked up for a couple of bucks on sale. i qouldnt pay full price for it but it was a bit of fun but i wouldnt go back to it

This game is broken for a few reasons: First I got so frustrated I hacked in armor and weapons and gave 4 of my survivors 500HP. The next mission I ran, they were grabbed so many times that had they not had long range fully automatic guns and armor, they all would have died. I'm alright with hard games: they can be fun. But I draw the mother♥♥♥♥ing line when I hack the game and am still at risk of losing due to sheer lack of fairness.  If you want it, Buy it, get out notepad, hack it, and have fun slaughtering zombies. Unless you do that this game's campaign is unplayable.

Cons:  Gameplay sucks.  Game won't play in full screen, only in window.  Pros: Only 80 cents.
Nice rts shooter enjoy playing for hours

Tons of fun and doesn't require a high-end PC to play; I play it right from my laptop WHILE recording in HD with barely ever any lag. And apparently it has multiplayer, which makes it twice as awesome!

Simply said this game looks bit ugly and clunky.   But don't just judge by the looks, the gameplay is funny as hell. I really enjoyed playing this and would love to play this in coop with friends. But sadly this one here just got a multiplayer 1vs1 only, which even isn't that easy to connect to each other. I tried it few times via the online IP my friend and I had, but we just couldn't manage to join us.  So I only can speak for the singleplayer which I played for a bit and that sure had the right amount of tatical placement of my characters, scavanging around for materials to craft better stuff, and trying to survive while figuring the mission objectives.  I totally can recommend this game!
This game is a horrible bore. Apparently I only played 17 minutes until I uninstalled it, but it felt like 2 hours.
Very fun game, and it's cheap aswell.

A Good Game, i actually enjoyed this. Its a unique game which is very fun, its very strategy based and you need equiptment and materials to survive, levels get harder and better weapons improve survival chances, a great game, definately worth it.
great point and click
0/7 please give me back my money i won this game for 2$

This game rocks. It takes all the best elements of the roguelikes I've been playing (Bionic Dues, Sword of the Pit, etc) and the top downs (Door Kickers, Monaco) and plays in real time with guts and gore. Very tactical and yet very intuitive, everything plays smoothly and all of the little things are done perfectly. It's got 4 modes, including a randomized survival mode (true roguelike), a campaign, a pvp mode, and one other... get it for 7 bucks while it's on sale or kick yourself later.
It's weird, clunky, and generally just not fun to play.
A very fun game that I play in short bursts.
It's fun to play. Not so hard but not too easy.

Its well worth 10euros! - quite a few items, resonably fair gameplay, tho a few spikes occur due to the sami randomnature of this game. Theres crafting, different weapons, and RPG-lite levveling system, semi randomized maps and campaigns, 4 game modes, hundreds of corpses onscreen, ah yes the sentry gun, and funky little details all over like lightning flashes, and footsteps.  The campaign allows you to 'take over' maps which can then be harvested for resources, and theres even missions to defend them. It works Nodule style, the zombie busting team working their way quick-travel by car, to each set of building complexes, then they try to clear them of zombies, zombie spawns, aswell as trying to free more survivors. Things can get super hectic at times, due to booby traps and other unforseen events, and special zombies appear- dissapointingly ripped straight from Left4Dead. Imagination. Hire me or something. Thats a minor gripe tho. Another is boobytraps that can be avoided mostly, but theres a roguelike factor in where the wireclippers are located, when the doors are auto locked. Could be next to the bomb. Could be in like 16 other drawers, cabinet etc. in the house, which can be a little steep if only a lone survivor made it in before the doors get locked. Its fairly minor again, i think ill break most hard maps with a bit of patience, or the computer will re-generate the map with randomized traps/alarms on next reload. I wouldnt say the game looks fantastic graphically, but theres a certain charm to everything. UI is fairly good allround, nothing too bothersome, except the level up indicator is hard to see, but thats fairly minor. All in all, 3 hours just went after i first booted it up, and im picky as hell! a good atmosphere gets going, and the pannicy bits, even if they result in death, are quite entertaining. - Looking forward tot he semi sequel Gauntlets! 8.5/10 instabuy on sale!
10/10  can't see anything and my squad died

A short review Not bad, but not as good as it could have been.  Pros...  ZOMBIES.  F.O.W. 'Fog of war' not bad. L.O.S. 'Line of sight' was a nice touch  Basic/Simple (Easy to play easy to learn) Very short tutorial mission/Lack of story  Guns Vs Melee (Such a hard choice) Pixel blood and corpses YAY  Cons...  Controls were not bad but lacked macro management and needed polishing. Attack move would have been nice. Maybe a Follow/Assist, guard/protect and Run/Hide commands?  The size of a single bandage? The size of blueprints. (not too bad i supose) Can't scrap previously crafted junk (Or can you? Wasn't exactly labeled) Alarms... (Dammit again...) Random Bombs... (That looks like TNT... It is)  Almost Empty houses and streets (needs more furniture and decor)  Did he just puke at me through a table, a window and two walls? Hey a Jumper just killed a man (gets jumped buy same one...) did he really not see that coming... Be very very quiet i sense a heart or two...
Pretty cool zombie game, I like it a lot!

Really nice casual game. Although I haven't played this game much (steam bug didnt record it all) I can say this is really fun to play, but not worth it's full price. I recommend you purchase it on the humble bundle store or on the steam sale. There are a decent amount of bugs but not that noticeable. If you have no internet or have nothing better to do, play this game - IT'S AWESOME!

Not much variety but a fun play, and not to long that the limited variety would negatively affect the enjoyment. No need to say much on this one, the videos and pictures say what you need to know.
